questions.question_text: Which command can provide the investigators with details of all the loaded modules on a Linux-based system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B > Forensic investigators should run the lsmod command to determine the status of modules loaded in the Linux Kernel.

questions.question_text: In a Linux-based system, what does the command `Last -F` display?

choices.A: Login and logout times and dates of the system

discussion.content:
A . -F, --fulltimes
 Print full login and logout times and dates.

Selected Answer: A
It is the correct answer. However, I could not find the information on the CHFIv10 book. Eventually I tried the command on a Linux system and it prints out exactly what the answer states.

questions.question_text: Which of the following examinations refers to the process of providing the opposing side in a trial the opportunity to question a witness?

discussion.content: By testifying on a preliminary question, a defendant in a criminal case does not become subject to cross-examination on other issues in the case

questions.question_text: Pick the statement which does not belong to the Rule 804. Hearsay Exceptions; Declarant Unavailable.

choices.A: Statement of personal or family history
choices.D: Statement under belief of impending death

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Rule 801: Statements That Are Not Hearsay
- Prior statement by witness
- Admission by party-opponent

Selected Answer: B
unavailable.
3. The four traditional exceptions requiring proof of unavailability are:
a) 804(b)(1) -- Former testimony.
b) 804(b)(2) -- Statements made under belief of impending death, known everywhere by its common law name: Dying Declarations.
c) 804(b)(3) -- Statements against interest
d) 804(b)(4) -- Statements of personal or family history

questions.question_text: NTFS sets a flag for the file once you encrypt it and creates an EFS attribute where it stores Data Decryption Field (DDF) and Data Recovery Field (DDR). Which of the following is not a part of DDF?

discussion.content:
In the context of NTFS and EFS (Encrypting File System), the Data Decryption Field (DDF) includes:

Encrypted FEK: The File Encryption Key used to encrypt the file data.
Checksum: Used for verifying the integrity of the encrypted data.
EFS Certificate Hash: Part of the cryptographic information used to decrypt the file.
Container Name is not part of the Data Decryption Field (DDF). It is not included in the EFS attributes related to encryption and decryption directly. so the answer is D container name

Selected Answer: B
CHFIv11 page 245. checksum is included in the Header, NOT the DDF.

B > The DDF contains:
User SID
Container Name 
Provider Name
EFS Certificate Hash
Encrypted FEK
